oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Reproductive performance with an automated activity monitoring system versus a synchronized breeding program
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Neves, Rafael C.
LeBlanc, Steven J.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: automated activity monitoring
reproductive management
performance
synchronized breeding programs
field conditions
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Automated activity monitoring is being increasingly used in the dairy industry for reproductive management, but there are few studies assessing its performance relative to synchronized breeding programs. The objective of this study was to compare reproductive performance of dairy cows managed with an automated activity monitoring (AAM) system with that of cows managed with a synchronized breeding program under field conditions.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2012; 200
